content:
Over in https://github.com/bytecodealliance/regalloc2/pull/244, I changed the name of the ion_checker fuzz target to ion. I also have another PR queued up to change the name in OSS Fuzz: https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/pull/14053. @Chris Fallin has already suggested we don't change the name but, perhaps rashly, I think we should try it and see what happens. I kind of hope the OSS Fuzz PR will merge before anyone sees any breakage but I'm giving a heads up here just in case.

Run fuzzing during `cargo test`; reorganize fuzzers by abrown · Pull Request #244 · bytecodealliance/regalloc2
This change moves the meat of the code for fuzzing regalloc2 into the main crate's fuzzing module. This has several minor benefits (easier to find, better LSP detection, same workspace for carg...
wasmtime: change the name of the `regalloc2` fuzzer by abrown · Pull Request #14053 · google/oss-fuzz
This change coordinates a name change to regalloc2's fuzz targets introduced in #244. The ion_checker target is now simply named ion.
